tools

Class NoiseNumberGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.NoiseNumberGenerator

  • public class NoiseNumberGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used for creating noisy values and that can pass them through a LowPassFilter.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NoiseNumberGenerator(double maxNoiseDelta, double randomSpikeRate, double spikeModifier)
      Creates a NoiseNumberGenerator that can be used to create noisy arrays and values.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double generateNoisedValue(double value)
      Gives a number some random noise and random chance of spiked value.
      double[] generateNoisyArray(double normalValue, int size)
      Generates an array of noisy values.
      double[] generateNoisySinusCurve(double lowestValue, double highestValue, int sinusPeriod, int size) 
      double[] generateNormalNoiseCurve(double lowValues, double highValues, int size)
      Creates an array of values where the first half are rising and the lower half is falling, with all values affected of random noise and spikes.
      static double[] getFilteredValues(double filterWeight, double[] rawValues)
      Filters an array of values through the LowPassFilter.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      static void outputFilteredValues(double[] filterWeights, double[] rawValues)
      Uses LowPassFilter to print out all of the values created by different weight values in a LowPassFilter, to the console.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • NoiseNumberGenerator

        public NoiseNumberGenerator(double maxNoiseDelta,
                            double randomSpikeRate,
                            double spikeModifier)
        Creates a NoiseNumberGenerator that can be used to create noisy arrays and values.
        Parameters:
        maxNoiseDelta - The absolute value that noise can become.
        randomSpikeRate - The chance of a spike occurring, from 0 to 1.
        spikeModifier - How much a value will be multiplied with a spike.

    • Method Detail

      • generateNoisyArray

        public double[] generateNoisyArray(double normalValue,
                                   int size)
        Generates an array of noisy values.
        Parameters:
        normalValue - Approximated average in the array.
        size - Size of array.
        Returns:
        Array filled of noisy values.

      • generateNoisedValue

        public double generateNoisedValue(double value)
        Gives a number some random noise and random chance of spiked value.
        Parameters:
        value - The default value.
        Returns:
        The altered number.

      • generateNormalNoiseCurve

        public double[] generateNormalNoiseCurve(double lowValues,
                                         double highValues,
                                         int size)
        Creates an array of values where the first half are rising and the lower half is falling, with all values affected of random noise and spikes.
        Parameters:
        lowValues - Lowest value (without added noise) in the array.
        highValues - Highest value (without added noise)
        size - Size of the array.
        Returns:
        The array that contains all of the values.

      • generateNoisySinusCurve

        public double[] generateNoisySinusCurve(double lowestValue,
                                        double highestValue,
                                        int sinusPeriod,
                                        int size)

      • outputFilteredValues

        public static void outputFilteredValues(double[] filterWeights,
                                        double[] rawValues)
        Uses LowPassFilter to print out all of the values created by different weight values in a LowPassFilter, to the console. The data is based on the rawValues parameter that the LowPassFilter will use.
        Parameters:
        filterWeights - The different LowPassFilter weights that will be used.
        rawValues - Raw values that will be input to the LowPassFilter.

      • getFilteredValues

        public static double[] getFilteredValues(double filterWeight,
                                         double[] rawValues)
        Filters an array of values through the LowPassFilter.
        Parameters:
        filterWeight - The weight for the LowPassFilter.
        rawValues - The data that the LowPassFilter will use.
        Returns:
        Array of values that have gone through the LowPassFilter

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
